Package io.github.jgame.net.udp

Class UDPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.jgame.net.udp.UDPClient
  • public class UDPClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Client implementation of UDP.

    • Field Detail

      • logger

        private java.util.logging.Logger logger
        Internal logger object used to log events.

      • socket

        private java.net.DatagramSocket socket
        The socket that the client is binded to.

      • host

        private java.net.InetAddress host
        The port that the client is connected to.

      • port

        private int port
        The port that the client is connected to.

      • pendingPackets

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​VerifyPacket> pendingPackets
        List of UUIDs of verified packets that have already been handled.

        When we get a packet with a UUID in this list, we do not call the parse(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object>, java.net.DatagramPacket) handler and simply send the confirm message.

      • verifiedByMe

        private java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> verifiedByMe
        Active VerifyPackets that need to be updated.

      • serialTable

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> serialTable
        Table used to serialize actions. See NetUtils.serialize()

      • deserialTable

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> deserialTable
        A reversed copy of the serialTable (values are keys and keys are values). Therefore, the serial table must not contain any duplicate values for this to work properly. Used for deserialization of actions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UDPClient

        public UDPClient​(java.lang.String listenHost,
                 int listenPort)
          throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                 java.net.SocketException
        Create a new UDP client at a random available address and listen to the specified port and host.
        Parameters:
        listenHost - Host to connect to
        listenPort - Port to connect to
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - Invalid hostname
        java.net.SocketException - Error opening DatagramSocket
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Invalid actionID

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public void parse​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> datagram,
                  java.net.DatagramPacket packet)
        Event handler for all packets sent to this address.
        Parameters:
        datagram - HashMap that was sent
        packet - Raw DatagramPacket

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Send the clientShutdown event and stop all pendingPackets
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Sending packets may fail.

      • getActionTable

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getActionTable()
        Used in constructor to determine action table. Action tables are used to serialize actions. See NetUtils.serialize()
        Returns:
        Table

      • update

        public void update()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Handle serverShutdown and kick events. Forward others to the parse(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object>, java.net.DatagramPacket) handler.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Reading the input and sending messages may fail.

      • onServerShutdown

        public void onServerShutdown()
        Handler for serverShutdown events

      • onKick

        public void onKick​(java.lang.String reason)
        Handler for kick events.
        Parameters:
        reason - Kicked for reason.

      • addVerifyPacket

        public void addVerifyPacket​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> datagram,
                            int frequency,
                            double backoff)
        Add a VerifyPacket to pendingPackets. (In other words, send the packet, and make sure it arrives!) See VerifyPacket
        Parameters:
        datagram - Packet to send
        frequency - Initial delay
        backoff - Exponential backoff

      • send

        public void send​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> datagram)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Send a message to the server
        Parameters:
        datagram - Packet to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Sending packets may fail.
